channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: That time physicist John Wheeler left classified H-bomb documents on a train
item.description: The whereabouts of the documents remains a mystery to this day.

item.title: Corellium notches partial victory in Apple iOS copyright case
item.description: Security firm’s actions both may and may not qualify under fair use, judge held.

item.title: With the right catalyst, we might make jet fuel from CO₂
item.description: As carbon capture gets cheaper, new applications could look attractive.

item.title: McConnell introduces bill tying $2K stimulus checks to Section 230 repeal
item.description: Maneuver is widely seen as a “poison pill,” and makes it unlikely legislation will pass

item.title: New virus variant found in Colorado while UK struggles to limit it
item.description: UK approves another vaccine, this one from AstraZeneca, as new COVID variant spreads.

item.title: Pandemic-boosted remote workforce may be in for a shock at tax time
item.description: You, your employer, and the taxman may have very different understandings of “home.”

item.title: Private party app pulled from App Store by Apple
item.description: “Secret party app” also pulled from TikTok after posting videos of unmasked ragers.

item.title: Amazon still hasn’t fixed its problem with bait-and-switch reviews
item.description: Amazon has done little to stop sellers from gaming its search algorithm.

item.title: Protecting great apes from the unknown effects of COVID-19
item.description: People who study and care for ‘em take lockdown-style measures to limit transmission risk.

item.title: WW1984 lassos solid box office return, record downloads for HBO Max
item.description: The film will still lose money, but Warner Bros. is fast-tracking a third film

item.title: Coverage of “wooden satellites” misses the point
item.description: Even if it works, the wood will remain in orbit, too.

item.title: Computer repairman suing Twitter for defamation, seeks $500 million
item.description: Claims Twitter’s blocking Hunter Biden laptop story amounts to calling him a hacker.

item.title: Did Columbus find early Caribs in 15th century Caribbean? Jury is still out
item.description: Two studies, published 11 months apart, yield conflicting results.

item.title: FAA finally sets rules for piloting small drones
item.description: All drones weighing over a quarter kilogram will need Remote ID transmitters.

item.title: The best accessories and MagSafe gear for your new iPhone 12
item.description: We tested the latest MagSafe cases, stands, and mounts—and some tried and true favorites.

item.title: Why AI is so power-hungry
item.description: It takes a lot of energy for machines to be trained with data sets.

item.title: How your digital trails wind up in the hands of the police
item.description: Phone calls. Web searches. Location tracks. Smart speaker requests.

item.title: All I want for Christmas is an awesome new curriculum
item.description: Revitalizing a curriculum in the middle of a chaos-inducing pandemic? Sure.

item.title: Antibodies and SARS-CoV-2 infections: The more the better
item.description: Oxford University Hospital tracked infections in 12,500 of its healthcare workers.

item.title: House overrides Trump veto, defying demand to repeal Section 230
item.description: Trump vetoed military funding in a bid to repeal Section 230.

item.title: Study sheds new light on polar explorer’s final hours, 100+ years later
item.description: Black smudge in Jørgen Brønlund’s diary showed he desperately tried to light a fire.

item.title: Reddit clone Voat, home to hate speech and QAnon, has shut down
item.description: The platform was a haven for communities deemed too racist or hateful for Reddit.

item.title: CD Projekt Red investors sue company over Cyberpunk 2077 debacle
item.description: Players aren’t the only ones angry about how the game’s console versions launched.

item.title: Like Titan, Pluto’s atmosphere is hazy, but for a different reason
item.description: Simple organic ices dominate, rather than bigger organic molecules.

item.title: Archaeologists excavate ancient Roman takeout counter at Pompeii
item.description: A 2,000-year-old quick-serve restaurant had a lot in common with modern ones.

item.title: The decade-long quest to stop “Spamford” Wallace
item.description: From the archives: After a spate of lawsuits dating back to the late ’90s, the feds step in.

item.title: Plastic pipes are polluting drinking water systems after wildfires
item.description: And it’s a risk in urban fires, too.
